history.text: I love anything with Iron Man, especially since Robert Downey Jr is Tony Stark.
Yeah, there is certainly an all-star cast involved.
Do you feel that humor plays a large role in this film?
This is why America is great, and we have Captain America.
Sorry, got ahead of myself there. Do you think humor is an important part of the film?
Yes humor is huge, a lot of people say the humor is so important.  Thanks to the characters and director.
It seems like the humor counterbalances what could otherwise be a somewhat traditional superhero formula film.
I agree, Batman never has any humor, the director Joss Whedon is credited with writing as well
what next?

Yes, both writing and directing certainly allows creative vision to unfold to its fullest. With Scarlett Johansen and even Samuel Jackson involved, et seems like he was reaching for the stars, though Samuel Jackson seems to have ended up with a smaller role.
I also like Rufflalo and how he is used in the film.  He is perfect for the Hulk.
I really think Tony Stark is the funniest.
I like how Iron Man is a team player.
The first key scene is a bit complex, but anything involving a wormhole has my attention...
Did you find the 143 minutes to be too long?
For me personally, a 143-minute film usually has to be a bit less predictable, humor notwithstanding, but I like the superheroes.
Yes, anything with superheroes is a winner.
I never quite got what S.H.I.E.L.D. stands for.
In this film we need to protect the Tesseract before Loki can get; otherwise, he will give it to the other
But he does get it and opens wormholes right and left! :-)
Well, it activates and then that creates the wormhole that he travels through to get to earth.
Loki is the type who is not easily satisfied...
I don't know if they should use the power of the Tesseract because it could back fire.  Maybe we should just protect it.
Yes, Loki doesn't understand not getting his way, I agree.
Did you like how the Helicarrier appears, and the attack begins.
Yeah, and it seems that the Avengers backfire against themselves with all their infighting.
It seems Loki will do anything for power.
I like the scene when Coulson dies but Fury uses that to motivate the Avengers to fight and win.
The final battle in New York is a classic superhero film ending scene - pretty exciting. WIth one final wormhole...

The final battle is awesome. 
This is when Loki uses the Tesseract to reek havoc.  All the Avengers are going to have to work together.
A classic film dynamic: Internal conflict replaced by unity against a common enemy.
Pretty impressive to intercept a nuclear missile and redirect it into a wormhole. But that's Iron Man for you. :-)
I just don't like that a superhero died
Yeah, it takes a tragedy to unite people (or superheroes) sometimes.
I like it when the Hulk finally gets Loki and beats him up, so funny.
It was also really cool how Fury used the nuclear weapon against the Other.
Fury's superiors were going to use the nuclear weapon against New York.  Thank God for Fury.
And for Iron Man / Stark... He redirected the missile.
And then it directly hit Chitauri's mothership, which disabled all his forces on Earth.
Do you agree with the rating of the movie?
Yes, 92% from Rotten Tomatoes, so yes, I agree.  What about you.
I think the CinemaScore rating is a little extreme, but yeah Rotten Tomatoes is about right.
Anyway, I think we have about covered it, haven't we?
What do we do?
Did you get that last text, I really don't know what is next?
Click on "Finish Conversation", I think... Gonna try it now... Thanks for the chat.
